meanings.definition: The foundation or base upon which railroad tracks are laid.
meanings.sent1: The workers repaired the trackbed to ensure the train tracks were stable.
meanings.sent2: The train smoothly glided along the trackbed, carrying passengers to their destination.
meanings.sent3: The trackbed decided to take a nap, tired of supporting the heavy train tracks all day.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the solid trackbed that carried her towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: The trackbed, like a loyal friend, never wavered in its support of the train tracks.

meanings.definition: The area of land or surface where tracks for trains are placed.
meanings.sent1: The trackbed was covered in fresh gravel to provide a stable surface for the train tracks.
meanings.sent2: The maintenance crew inspected the trackbed for any signs of wear and tear.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ran along the trackbed, trying to race the train.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was the trackbed where her thoughts raced like speeding trains.
meanings.sent5: The trackbed stretched out endlessly, guiding the train on its journey.
